content.description:
Start standing with a right-hand crimp and a left-hand gaston on the arete. Move left hand up to a small crimp and drop right hand into the left starting hold. Fire to the apex of the boulder from here and top out on good holds.  

  None of the holds are terrible, there is just a distinct lack of feet. 

  There is also a sit start to be added, but it may actually bring the quality of the climb down.
content.location: This is the right arete when looking at the boulder from the trail.

content.description: Sit start left the arete on a divot. Climb the arete to an easy top out. No defined crux just sustained sloper arete climbing. If it was double the length it would be classic.
content.location: The left arete if you are looking from the trail.

content.description: A short, eight-foot boulder with a couple lines on it. Fun climbing although the lack of height takes away from the quality a bit.
